snippet: The first clues that led to the grisly discovery of the bodies of three missing Israeli teenagers came only hours after their abduction in the West Bank was reported.
abstract: Israeli security forces turn their full attention to searching for two Palestinian suspects in kidnapping and killing of three Israeli teenagers, as tensions between Israel and Hamas continue to escalate; almost from the start, Israel sought to pin the abduction on Hamas, whose reconciliation deal with Palestine Liberation Organization it vigorously opposes; Hamas leaders have praised the kidnappings but not claimed credit for it.

byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN and SAID GHAZALI
byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren reported from Jerusalem, and Said Ghazali from Hebron and Azariya, West Bank. Isabel Kershner contributed reporting from Shalvim and Modiiin, Israel, and Nayef Hashlamoun from Hebron.

lead_paragraph: The first clues that led to the grisly discovery of the bodies of three missing Israeli teenagers came only hours after their abduction in the West Bank was reported.

headline.seo: Israeli Teenagers Found Dead; Hamas Under Pressure
headline.main: A Trail of Clues Leading to Victims and Heartbreak
headline.print_headline: A Trail of Clues Leading to Victims and Heartbreak
